undertaking.英释: an important job, piece of work, or activity that you are responsible for

maintenance.英释: the repairs, painting etc that are necessary to keep something in good condition

contemplate.英释: to think about something seriously for a period of time

circulation.英释: the movement of blood around your body

resourceful.英释: good at finding ways of dealing with practical problems

explanatory.英释: giving information about something or describing how something works, in order to make it easier to understand

combination.英释: two or more different things that exist together or are used or put together

immigration.英释: the process of entering another country in order to live there permanently

considerate.英释: always thinking of what other people need or want and being careful not to upset them

prohibition.英释: the act of saying that something is illegal

consequence.英释: something that happens as a result of a particular action or set of conditions

inspiration.英释: a good idea about what you should do, write, say etc, especially one which you get suddenly

generations.英释: A generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age, especially when they are considered as having the same experiences or attitudes

spontaneous.英释: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it

exclusively.英释: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else

consumption.英释: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

application.英释: the practical purpose for which a machine, idea etc can be used, or a situation when this is used

immortality.英释: the state of living for ever or being remembered for ever

demonstrate.英释: to show or prove something clearly

frustrating.英释: making you feel annoyed, upset, or impatient because you cannot do what you want to do

humiliation.英释: a feeling of shame and great embarrassment, because you have been made to look stupid or weak

inheritance.英释: money, property etc that you receive from someone who has died

fundamental.英释: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

respectable.中释: 值得尊敬的；人格高尚的
respectable.英释: someone who is respectable behaves in a way that is considered socially acceptable

refreshment.英释: small amounts of food and drink that are provided at a meeting, sports event etc

stethoscope.英释: an instrument that a doctor uses to listen to your heart or breathing

appropriate.英释: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose

disseminate.英释: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

commentator.英释: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

preliminary.英释: happening before something that is more important, often in order to prepare for it

personality.英释: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

masterpiece.英释: a work of art, a piece of writing or music etc that is of very high quality or that is the best that a particular artist, writer etc has produced

resemblance.英释: if there is a resemblance between two people or things, they are similar, especially in the way they look

pessimistic.英释: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

alternative.英释: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

unconscious.英释: a feeling or thought that is unconscious is one that you have without realizing it

citizenship.中释: [法] 公民身份，公民资格；国籍；公民权
citizenship.英释: the legal right of belonging to a particular country

polytechnic.中释: 工艺学校；理工专科学校
polytechnic.英释: a word used in the names of high schools or colleges in the US, where you can study technical or scientific subjects

legislation.英释: a law or set of laws

cauliflower.英释: a vegetable with green leaves around a firm white centre

expenditure.英释: the total amount of money that a government, organization, or person spends during a particular period of time

manufacture.英释: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts

hospitalize.英释: if someone is hospitalized, they are taken into a hospital for treatment

consecutive.英释: consecutive numbers or periods of time follow one after the other without any interruptions

preposition.英释: a word that is used before a noun,  pronoun  , or  gerund  to show place, time, direction etc. In the phrase ‘the trees in the park’, ‘in’ is a preposition.

documentary.英释: a film or television or a radio programme that gives detailed information about a particular subject

materialism.中释: 唯物主义；唯物论；物质主义
materialism.英释: the belief that money and possessions are more important than art, religion, moral beliefs etc – used in order to show disapproval

thereabouts.英释: near a particular time, place, number etc, but not exactly

geopolitics.中释: 地缘政治学；地理政治论
geopolitics.英释: ideas and activities relating to the way that a country’s position, population etc affect its political development and its relationship with other countries, or the study of this

indifferent.中释: 漠不关心的；无关紧要的；中性的，中立的
indifferent.英释: not at all interested in someone or something

conjunction.中释: 结合；[语] 连接词；同时发生
conjunction.英释: a combination of different things that have come together by chance

innumerable.英释: very many, or too many to be counted

insecticide.英释: a chemical substance used for killing insects

temperament.英释: the emotional part of someone’s character, especially how likely they are to be happy, angry etc

adventurous.中释: 爱冒险的；大胆的；充满危险的
adventurous.英释: not afraid of taking risks or trying new things

disapproval.英释: If you feel or show disapproval of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not approve of them

descriptive.中释: 描写的，叙述的；描写性的

everlasting.英释: continuing for ever, even after someone has died

thermometer.英释: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

appreciable.中释: 可感知的；可评估的；相当可观的
appreciable.英释: An appreciable amount or effect is large enough to be important or clearly noticed

interviewer.中释: 采访者；会见者；面谈者；进行面试者
interviewer.英释: the person who asks the questions in an interview

merchandise.英释: to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising

probability.中释: 可能性；机率；[数] 或然率
probability.英释: how likely something is, sometimes calculated in a mathematical way

proletarian.中释: 普罗阶级的，无产阶级的
proletarian.英释: Proletarian means relating to the proletariat

pornography.英释: magazines, films etc that show sexual acts and images in a way that is intended to make people feel sexually excited

imaginative.中释: 富于想象的；有创造力的

destruction.英释: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

calculation.中释: 计算；估计；计算的结果；深思熟虑
calculation.英释: A calculation is something that you think about and work out mathematically. Calculation is the process of working something out mathematically.

superiority.英释: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

approximate.英释: an approximate number, amount, or time is close to the exact number, amount etc, but could be a little bit more or less than it

extravagant.中释: 奢侈的；浪费的；过度的；放纵的
extravagant.英释: spending or costing a lot of money, especially more than is necessary or more than you can afford

complacency.英释: a feeling of satisfaction with a situation or with what you have achieved, so that you stop trying to improve or change things – used to show disapproval

standardize.英释: to make all the things of one particular type the same as each other

spectacular.中释: 壮观的，惊人的；公开展示的

progressive.英释: A progressive is someone who is progressive

proficiency.英释: a good standard of ability and skill

concentrate.英释: a substance or liquid which has been made stronger by removing most of the water from it

cornerstone.英释: something that is extremely important because everything else depends on it

requirement.英释: something that someone needs or asks for

catastrophe.英释: a terrible event in which there is a lot of destruction, suffering, or death

counterpart.中释: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
counterpart.英释: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

disturbance.英释: a situation in which people behave violently in public

acupuncture.中释: 针刺；[中医] 针刺疗法
acupuncture.英释: a treatment for pain and disease that involves pushing special needles into parts of the body

superlative.中释: 最高级；最好的人；最高程度；夸大话
superlative.英释: the superlative form of an adjective or adverb. For example, ‘biggest’ is the superlative of ‘big’.

unjustified.中释: 不正当的；未被证明其正确的
unjustified.英释: If you describe a belief or action as unjustified, you think that there is no good reason for having it or doing it

distinction.中释: 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章
distinction.英释: a clear difference or separation between two similar things

nervousness.中释: 神经质；[心理] 神经过敏；紧张不安

archaeology.英释: the study of ancient societies by examining what remains of their buildings,  grave s  , tools etc

linguistics.英释: the study of language in general and of particular languages, their structure, grammar, and history

sportswoman.英释: a woman who plays many different sports

impractical.中释: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
impractical.英释: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

switchboard.英释: a system used to connect telephone calls in an office building, hotel etc, or the people who operate the system

regrettable.中释: 令人遗憾的；可惜的；可悲的；抱歉的
regrettable.英释: something that is regrettable is unpleasant, and you wish things could be different

enlargement.中释: 放大；放大的照片；增补物
enlargement.英释: a photograph that has been printed again in a bigger size

sentimental.中释: 伤感的；多愁善感的；感情用事的；寓有情感的
sentimental.英释: someone who is sentimental is easily affected by emotions such as love, sympathy, sadness etc, often in a way that seems silly to other people

practicable.中释: 可用的；行得通的；可实行的
practicable.英释: a practicable way of doing something is possible in a particular situation

conditional.英释: a sentence or  clause  that is expressed in a conditional form

fingerprint.英释: If someone is fingerprinted, the police take their fingerprints

improvement.英释: the act of improving something or the state of being improved

insensitive.中释: 感觉迟钝的，对…没有感觉的
insensitive.英释: Someone who is insensitive to a situation or to a need does not think or care about it

theoretical.中释: 理论的；理论上的；假设的；推理的
theoretical.英释: relating to the study of ideas, especially scientific ideas, rather than with practical uses of the ideas or practical experience

interchange.英释: an exchange, especially of ideas or thoughts

accommodate.英释: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

paperweight.英释: a small heavy object used to hold pieces of paper in place

participate.英释: to take part in an activity or event

sovereignty.中释: 主权；主权国家；君主；独立国
sovereignty.英释: complete freedom and power to govern

rectangular.英释: having the shape of a rectangle

considering.英释: used after you have given an opinion, to say that something is true in spite of a situation that makes it seem surprising

experienced.中释: 老练的，熟练的；富有经验的
experienced.英释: possessing skills or knowledge because you have done something often or for a long time

battlefield.英释: a place where a battle is being fought or has been fought

renaissance.英释: a new interest in something, especially a particular form of art, music etc, that has not been popular for a long period

suitability.英释: the degree to which something or someone has the right qualities for a particular purpose

nightingale.英释: a small bird that sings very beautifully, especially at night

acknowledge.中释: 承认；答谢；报偿；告知已收到
acknowledge.英释: to admit or accept that something is true or that a situation exists

predecessor.英释: someone who had your job before you started doing it

investigate.英释: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

convenience.英释: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

contraction.英释: a very strong and painful movement of a muscle, especially the muscles around the  womb  during birth

anniversary.英释: a date on which something special or important happened in a previous year

trustworthy.英释: able to be trusted and depended on

mischievous.中释: 淘气的；（人、行为等）恶作剧的；有害的
mischievous.英释: someone who is mischievous likes to have fun, especially by playing tricks on people or doing things to annoy or embarrass them

shareholder.英释: someone who owns shares in a company or business

delinquency.中释: 行为不良，违法犯罪；失职，怠工
delinquency.英释: illegal or immoral behaviour or actions, especially by young people

opportunity.英释: a chance to do something or an occasion when it is easy for you to do something

grammatical.中释: 文法的；符合语法规则的

recognition.中释: 识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认
recognition.英释: the act of realizing and accepting that something is true or important

discrepancy.英释: a difference between two amounts, details, reports etc that should be the same

contaminate.英释: to make a place or substance dirty or harmful by putting something such as chemicals or poison in it

distinguish.中释: 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出
distinguish.英释: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people

displeasure.英释: Someone's displeasure is a feeling of annoyance that they have about something that has happened

imagination.中释: [心理] 想象力；空想；幻想物
imagination.英释: the ability to form pictures or ideas in your mind

aeronautics.英释: the science of designing and flying planes

publication.英释: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to stores to be sold

controversy.英释: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

association.中释: 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想
association.英释: an organization that consists of a group of people who have the same aims, do the same kind of work etc

tobacconist.中释: （主英）烟草商；烟草制品零售商
tobacconist.英释: someone who has a shop that sells tobacco, cigarettes etc

calligraphy.英释: the art of producing beautiful writing using special pens or brushes, or the writing produced this way

preparation.英释: the process of preparing something or preparing for something

speedometer.英释: an instrument in a vehicle that shows how fast it is going

prosecution.英释: when a charge is made against someone for a crime, or when someone is judged for a crime in a court of law

secretarial.英释: relating to the work of a secretary

consolidate.英释: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

commemorate.英释: to do something to show that you remember and respect someone important or an important event in the past

scaffolding.中释: 脚手架；搭脚手架的材料
scaffolding.英释: a set of poles and boards that are built into a structure for workers to stand on when they are working on the outside of a building

declaration.中释: （纳税品等的）申报；宣布；公告；申诉书
declaration.英释: an important official statement about a particular situation or plan, or the act of making this statement

electrician.英释: someone whose job is to connect or repair electrical wires or equipment

familiarize.英释: to learn about something so that you understand it, or to teach someone else about something so that they understand it

collaborate.英释: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art

parenthesis.英释: if you say something in parenthesis, you say it while you are talking about something else in order to add information or explain something

interpreter.英释: someone who changes spoken words from one language into an-other, especially as their job

disposition.中释: 处置；[心理] 性情；[军] 部署；倾向
disposition.英释: a particular type of character which makes someone likely to behave or react in a certain way

ideological.英释: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas

rattlesnake.英释: a poisonous American snake that shakes its tail to make a noise when it is angry

possibility.中释: 可能性；可能发生的事物
possibility.英释: if there is a possibility that something is true or that something will happen, it might be true or it might happen
